meta.hint: The subject and the verb in a sentence must agree.example The subject pronouns she, he and it name only one person or thing, so they are singular. example When a subject is singular, use a singular verb. Singular verbs end in -s or -es.example Example - He watches the neighbour's baby.example                  It needs a new lock.example The subject pronouns we and they name more than one person or thing, so they are plural. example The pronoun you can also be plural. When a subject is plural, use a plural verb. Plural example verbs usually do not end in -s or -es.example Example - We walk home.example                  They finish early.example The singular subject pronouns I and you do not follow these rules. They name only oneexample person or thing, but they should be used with plural verbs.example Example - You sing better than I do!example                  I close the windows at night.
